text: Involvement of Rel , <extra_id_0> Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins in binding activity to the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response element / AP-1 sequence in human T cells .
<extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an important costimulatory molecule in the activation of human T cells .

Costimulation of T cells through both the Ag receptor and <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> leads to high level <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production , which is vital to the development of an immune response in vivo .

text: Previous reports have suggested the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation contributes to the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter by up - regulating the activity of several transcription factors , including AP-1 and nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) / Rel family members as well as an uncharacterized transcription factor called <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response complex .

text: While several lines of investigation have suggested that NF-kappaB / Rel family members make up the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response complex transcription factor , other work has not supported this conclusion .

Recent studies suggest that the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response element ( CD28RE ) does not function independently but works instead in conjunction with the adjacent promoter proximal AP-1 - binding site and this hypothesis is confirmed here .
Also in the current study , binding activity to the CD28RE/AP-1 sequence of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter is evaluated .
Although four specific complexes can be detected binding to this sequence , only one of these complexes is specific for both the CD28RE and the adjacent AP-1 site .

Of the NF-kappaB / Rel family members tested , this CD28RE / AP-1 - specific complex contains predominantly <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , despite the fact that both <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can efficiently bind to the CD28RE .

text: <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are also found in this CD28RE / AP-1 - specific complex .

These data indicate that functional complexes encompassing both the CD28RE and the AP-1 - binding sites influence <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity in <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - costimulated T cells .
